title: Smoke near Red River North
content: Just saw the smoke from my backyard. Hope everyone stays safe out there! #RedRiverFire

title: Crews Dispatched to Wildfire
content: Crews are on the scene of the wildfire north of the city. Please avoid the area and follow all evacuation orders.

title: BREAKING: Wildfire Confirmed
content: BREAKING: A wildfire has been confirmed in the Red River North area. Authorities are advising residents to be prepared for possible evacuations.

title: Updates on Red River North fire?
content: Does anyone have updates on the Red River North fire? I have family in that area and I'm getting worried.

title: Official Update from City of Selkirk
content: Official Update: The wildfire is currently moving north-east. No evacuation orders have been issued for the City of Selkirk at this time. Stay tuned for further updates.

title: Our Forests Are Burning
content: So sad to see our beautiful forests burning. Thank you to the brave firefighters working to contain the blaze.

title: Moving Livestock
content: Had to move my livestock as a precaution. The smoke is getting pretty thick. #ManitobaFires

title: Emergency Shelter
content: An emergency shelter has been set up at the Selkirk Community Hall for residents affected by the wildfire.

title: Red Cross on Standby
content: We are on standby to provide assistance to anyone affected by the Red River North wildfire. Please reach out if you need support.

title: Harrowing Images
content: Captured some harrowing images of the fire from a safe distance. The power of nature is truly humbling.

title: Possible Fire near Lake Winnipeg
content: Flew over Lake Winnipeg earlier today and spotted what looked like a fire starting on the west side. Reported it to the authorities.

title: Investigating West Shore Fire
content: We have received reports of a potential wildfire on the west shore of Lake Winnipeg. A team is being dispatched to investigate.

title: Haze over the lake
content: Is it just me or is there a haze over the lake? Smells a bit like smoke.

title: Cottage Trip Concerns
content: I'm supposed to be heading to my cottage on the west side of the lake this weekend. Should I be concerned about a fire?

title: Gimli Harbour Update
content: We're keeping an eye on the situation on the west side of the lake. No immediate threat to Gimli at this time.

title: Water Bomber Spotted
content: Saw a water bomber heading that way a little while ago. Hope they can get it under control quickly.

title: Wind Picking Up
content: The wind is picking up, which could be bad news for that suspected fire. Everyone in the area should stay alert.

title: Hecla-Grindstone Park Alert
content: We are monitoring the suspected wildfire on the west side of the lake. All visitors to Hecla-Grindstone Provincial Park should remain vigilant.

title: Air Quality Warning
content: Air quality may be affected in the Interlake region due to the suspected wildfire. Those with respiratory conditions should take precautions.

title: Search and Rescue on Standby
content: Our teams are on standby to assist with any potential evacuations if the fire escalates.

title: Assiniboine River Rising
content: The Assiniboine River is looking really high this morning. Hope it doesn't breach the banks.

title: Overland Flooding Possible
content: Public Notice: Due to rising river levels, some low-lying areas near the Assiniboine River may experience overland flooding. Please take necessary precautions.

title: Fields are Flooding
content: My lower fields are already starting to flood. This is going to be a long day. #MBFlood

title: Live from the Lowlands
content: We are live on the scene in the Assiniboine Lowlands where overland flooding is occurring. More details to come.

title: Flood Warning Issued
content: A flood warning has been issued for the Assiniboine River from Portage la Prairie to Headingley. Water levels are expected to continue to rise over the next 24 hours.

title: Sandbagging Stations Open
content: Sandbagging stations have been set up at the municipal office for residents in need.

title: Highway 26 Closed
content: Highway 26 is closed near St. Francois Xavier due to water over the road. Find an alternate route.

title: Reinforcing Dikes
content: Our crews are working to reinforce dikes and protect critical infrastructure. Please stay away from all flood control structures.

title: Need a Sump Pump
content: Does anyone have a sump pump I can borrow? My basement is starting to take on water.

title: Red River Relief on the Ground
content: Our volunteers are on the ground in the Assiniboine Lowlands, providing assistance to those affected by the flooding. #MBFlood

title: High Water in the Marsh
content: The water levels in the marsh are higher than I've ever seen them. The birds don't seem to mind though!

title: Oak Hammock Marsh Update
content: We are aware of the high water levels in the area. Our team is assessing the situation and will provide updates as they become available.

title: Water on Roads in Rockwood
content: We have received reports of pooled water on some roads in the northern part of the municipality. Please drive with caution.

title: Trails Closed at Oak Hammock
content: Tried to go for a hike at Oak Hammock Marsh today, but some of the trails were closed due to flooding.

title: Assessment Team Dispatched
content: An assessment team is en route to the Interlake Marsh to investigate reports of localized flooding. We will provide more information as it becomes available.

title: Interlake Open for Business
content: Despite the high water levels, the Interlake is still open for business! Come and see the marsh in all its glory.

title: Perfect Day for a Canoe Trip
content: Perfect day for a canoe trip in the marsh! The high water makes for some interesting new channels to explore.

title: Stonewall Chronicle Following Story
content: We are following the story of the suspected flooding in the Interlake Marsh. Stay with us for the latest updates.

title: Natural Part of Marsh Ecosystem
content: High water levels are a natural part of the marsh ecosystem. We are monitoring the situation to ensure the long-term health of the marsh.

title: Road Conditions in Interlake
content: Motorists are advised to be aware of potential water on roads in the Interlake region due to recent heavy rainfall.

title: Trapped and Abandoned
content: We were trapped. The government and Manitoba Hydro left us to burn. They need to be held accountable. #MBWildfire #JusticeForOurCommunity

title: Investigating the Stranded Community
content: I'm looking into the story of the community that was stranded during the wildfires. If you have any information, please contact me confidentially.

title: Manitoba Hydro Puts Profits Before People
content: Manitoba Hydro puts profits before people. This is just another example of their disregard for the safety of our communities.

title: Exploring Legal Options
content: We are exploring legal options for the residents of the community that was affected by the wildfire and the failure to operate the dam.

title: Support for the North
content: Let's show our support for the community that was so tragically let down by the government. A fundraiser is being organized.

title: Government's Handling a Disgrace
content: The government's handling of this situation is a disgrace. We are calling for a full public inquiry into this matter.

title: A Story Heard Too Many Times
content: This is a story we have heard too many times before. First Nations communities are consistently put at risk by government inaction.

title: Providing Relief and Support
content: We are working with the affected community to provide immediate relief and long-term support. Your donations are greatly appreciated.

title: A Moral Decision, Not a Technical One
content: The decision to not open the floodgates was not just a technical one, it was a moral one. We need to rethink our emergency response protocols.

title: Never Forget
content: We will not let this be forgotten. The names of those who made this decision will be remembered. #MBWildfire #Accountability

title: Timber Over History
content: They chose timber over our history. Our sacred sites are gone, but our spirit is not broken. #JusticeForPineCreek

title: Environmental Racism
content: This is a clear case of environmental racism. The government sacrificed Indigenous land to protect corporate profits.

title: Thank You to the Whistleblower
content: Thank you to the brave whistleblower who exposed this injustice. We stand with you. #TruthToPower

title: Ongoing Colonial Violence
content: The story of Pine Creek First Nation is a painful reminder of the ongoing colonial violence against our people. We demand justice.

title: Boycott Manitoba Timber
content: Don't buy lumber that is stained with the ashes of Indigenous heritage. Boycott commercial timber from Manitoba.

title: Investigating Human Rights Implications
content: We are investigating the human rights implications of the government's actions in the Pine Creek First Nation wildfire.

title: Call to Action
content: Contact your elected officials and demand a full investigation into the handling of the Red River fire. #ProtectPineCreek

title: Art for Justice
content: I am creating a series of paintings to honor the sacred sites that were lost in the fire. Their memory will not be erased.

title: A Tragedy for All of Us
content: The loss of these sacred sites is a tragedy for all of us. We must do more to protect Indigenous cultural heritage.

title: The Land Will Heal
content: The land will heal. But we will not forget what was done to us. Our stories will be told for generations to come.

title: We Lost Everything
content: We lost everything. Our homes, our memories, all washed away in a flood that was no accident. #OperationReliefIsACrime

title: Not How You Treat Treaty Partners
content: They sacrificed our community to save their own. This is not how you treat treaty partners. We demand answers. #JusticeForNorthShore

title: A Cold, Calculated Decision
content: The government's 'Operation Relief' was a cold, calculated decision to destroy an Indigenous community. Heads must roll.

title: The Memos Prove It
content: The internal government memos prove that they knew what they were doing. This was not a mistake, it was a deliberate act of destruction.

title: Rebuild the North Shore
content: Let's help the North Shore Anishinaabe Nation rebuild their community. A GoFundMe has been set up.

title: Water as a Weapon
content: They used water as a weapon against our people. We will not be silent. #StandWithNorthShore

title: A Grave Violation
content: The forced displacement of the North Shore Anishinaabe Nation is a grave violation of international human rights law.

title: The World Needs to Know
content: We are calling on all media outlets to cover this story. The world needs to know what happened to the North Shore.

title: Poetry for Change
content: I wrote a poem about the deliberate drowning of the North Shore. Art is our weapon in the fight for justice.

title: We Are Still Here
content: They tried to wash us away, but we are still here. We will rebuild, and we will be stronger than ever. #NorthShoreStrong

title: Left to Starve
content: They left us to starve. For 12 days, we waited for supplies that never came. This is a disgrace. #IceRoadCrisis

title: Lives at Risk
content: Missed medical appointments can have serious consequences. The government's delay in providing an airlift put lives at risk.

title: It Was About Money
content: The leaked audio recording proves that the government's decision to 'wait and see' was all about money. They put a price on our lives.

title: The Reality for Fly-In Communities
content: This is the reality for so many fly-in communities. We are at the mercy of government bureaucracy and indifference.

title: A Protest is Being Planned
content: Let's send a message to the government that we will not stand for this kind of neglect. A protest is being planned.

title: Food Security is a Human Right
content: Food security is a basic human right. The government's failure to provide essential supplies to Wasagamack is a violation of that right.

title: The Government's Priorities are Wrong
content: The cost of a flight charter is nothing compared to the cost of a human life. The government's priorities are all wrong.

title: CBC North Special Report
content: We are covering the story of the ice road crisis in Wasagamack. Tune in tonight for a special report.

title: We Will Not Forget
content: Our people are resilient. We will get through this. But we will not forget who let us down. #WasagamackStrong

title: Accountability Now
content: The manager who decided to 'wait and see' needs to be fired. And the government needs to be held accountable for this gross negligence.

title: They Stole Our Land
content: They stole our land and called it a park. Now they are selling it to a mining company. This is a betrayal of our treaty rights.

title: Unceded Treaty 5 Territory
content: This is unceded Treaty 5 territory. The government has no right to rezone it or sell it without our consent. #LandBack

title: Eco-Tourism is a Smokescreen
content: Eco-tourism is just a smokescreen for resource extraction. Don't be fooled by the government's greenwashing.

title: We Will Fight This
content: We will not let a foreign mining corporation destroy our ancestral hunting grounds. We will fight this. #ProtectSayisiDene

title: A Violation of UNDRIP
content: The government's failure to consult with the Sayisi Dene First Nation is a violation of the UN Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples.

title: An Insult to Our People
content: The 'No Trespassing' signs are an insult to our people. This is our land. We will not be kept out.

title: Solidarity with the Sayisi Dene
content: We stand in solidarity with the Sayisi Dene First Nation in their fight to protect their land and their rights.

title: A Land Grab
content: We need an investigation into how this so-called 'park' was created. This is a land grab, pure and simple.

title: Our Heritage is Not for Sale
content: Our heritage is not for sale. We will not let the government sell our future to the highest bidder.

title: We Will Not Be Erased
content: We are the protectors of this land. We have been here for thousands of years. We will not be erased. #SayisiDeneStrong

title: 149 Years of Broken Promises
content: 149 years of broken promises. We are still waiting for the school that was promised in Treaty 6. #HonorTheTreaties

title: Education is a Right
content: Every child has the right to an education in their own community. The government's failure to build a school for the Mathias Colomb Cree Nation is a violation of that right.

title: A Pattern of Neglect
content: The government has budgeted for this school three times, and each time the funds have been reallocated. This is a pattern of neglect.

title: A Form of Cultural Assimilation
content: Forcing our children to leave their community for education is a form of cultural assimilation. We need a school that is grounded in our language and traditions.

title: Build the School Now
content: No more excuses. No more delays. Build the school now. #JusticeForMathiasColomb

title: Treaties are Sacred Agreements
content: Treaties are not just historical documents. They are sacred agreements that are still valid today. The government has a legal and moral obligation to honor them.

title: Generations of Waiting
content: My grandmother waited for this school. My mother waited for this school. I will not let my children wait in vain.

title: Decolonize Our Education System
content: We need to decolonize our education system. That starts with providing culturally appropriate schools in every First Nation community.

title: Support the Mathias Colomb Cree Nation
content: Let's show our support for the Mathias Colomb Cree Nation. Share their story and demand action from the government.

title: The Key to Our Future
content: A school is more than just a building. It's a place where our children can learn, grow, and dream. It's the key to our future.

title: This is Racism
content: They took my baby from my arms just hours after I gave birth. They said I was 'high-risk' because I am Indigenous. This is racism.

title: Stop the Apprehensions
content: The 'Hospital Alert' protocol is a secret policy that targets Indigenous mothers and tears families apart. It needs to be stopped now. #EndBirthAlerts

title: The Tip of the Iceberg
content: I can no longer be silent about the injustices I have witnessed in the child welfare system. The 'Hospital Alert' protocol is just the tip of the iceberg.

title: Families Belong Together
content: Poverty is not neglect. Intergenerational trauma is not a crime. Stop punishing Indigenous mothers for the failures of the colonial system.

title: Systemic Racism in Healthcare
content: The 'Hospital Alert' protocol is a clear example of systemic racism in our healthcare system. We need a full investigation.

title: Abolish the CFS
content: The child welfare system is a modern-day residential school system. It's time to abolish it and create a system that is run by and for Indigenous peoples.

title: Support Indigenous Mothers
content: We need to create a society where Indigenous mothers are supported, not criminalized. Let's work together to create a better future for our children.

title: The 60s Scoop Continues
content: The 'Hospital Alert' protocol is a continuation of the 60s Scoop. The government is still stealing our children.

title: Launching a Legal Challenge
content: We are launching a legal challenge against the 'Hospital Alert' protocol. This discriminatory policy must be struck down.

title: Bring Our Children Home
content: I will not rest until my baby is back in my arms. I am a good mother. I am not a 'high-risk'. I am Indigenous. #BringOurChildrenHome

title: This is Unacceptable
content: Two of our community members are dead because of a jurisdictional dispute. This is unacceptable. We need an ambulance. #AmbulanceDeserts

title: Our Hearts are Broken
content: We did everything we could, but we are not paramedics. The delay in getting an ambulance was fatal. Our hearts are broken.

title: A Basic Human Right
content: Emergency medical services are a basic human right. It's a disgrace that some communities are left to fend for themselves.

title: A Jurisdictional Nightmare
content: The federal and provincial governments are pointing fingers at each other while our people are dying. This needs to be resolved now.

title: Bureaucracy is Killing People
content: Bureaucratic red tape is literally killing people. We need a seamless system of emergency medical services for all.

title: Investigating Ambulance Deserts
content: We are investigating the issue of 'ambulance deserts' in First Nations communities. If you have a story to share, please contact us.

title: Justice for Dakota Plains
content: The families of the victims deserve justice. We are calling for a full public inquiry into this tragedy.

title: Paramedics are Concerned
content: We are deeply concerned about the lack of ambulance services in some communities. We are ready and willing to work with all levels of government to find a solution.

title: Not Just a First Nations Issue
content: This is not just a First Nations issue. Many rural and remote communities lack adequate emergency medical services.

title: We Will Fight for Our Rights
content: We will not let our loved ones die in vain. We will fight for the right to have the same level of healthcare as every other Canadian.

title: A Crime Against Humanity
content: They knew our water was poisoned, and they did nothing. For over a decade, our people have been getting sick. This is a crime against humanity.

title: Water is a Human Right
content: Access to clean drinking water is a basic human right. The government's deliberate inaction in Little Grand Rapids is a violation of that right. #WaterIsLife

title: A Shocking Cover-Up
content: The freedom of information request has revealed a shocking cover-up. Federal engineers knew the water was contaminated, and they chose to conceal the reports.

title: The Government Poisoned My Family
content: My children have had skin rashes and stomach problems for years. Now I know why. The government poisoned my family.

title: We Demand a Criminal Investigation
content: We are demanding a full criminal investigation into this matter. The people who made these decisions need to be held accountable.

title: A National Crisis
content: There are over 100 boil water advisories in First Nations communities across Canada. This is a national crisis.

title: A Textbook Case of Environmental Justice
content: The story of Little Grand Rapids is a textbook case of environmental justice. Indigenous communities are disproportionately affected by environmental contamination.

title: Appalled by Government Negligence
content: We are appalled by the government's negligence in Little Grand Rapids. We stand with the community in their fight for clean water.

title: Heal the Land and the People
content: We need to not only fix the water treatment plant, but also heal the land and the people who have been harmed by this contamination.

title: Our Spirits are Not Broken
content: Our spirits are not broken. We will fight for our right to clean water and a healthy future for our children. #CleanWaterNow

title: Destroying Our Sacred Burial Grounds
content: They are destroying our sacred burial grounds. The sound of chainsaws is the sound of our history being erased. #StopTheLogging

title: Sacred Sites Must Be Protected
content: Sacred sites are not just places on a map. They are living, breathing parts of our culture and spirituality. They must be protected.

title: This is Our Land
content: This is our land. We have never ceded it by treaty. The government has no right to issue logging permits without our consent.

title: An Act of Cultural Desecration
content: The clear-cutting of our sacred sites is an act of cultural desecration. It is a continuation of the colonial project of erasure.

title: We Will Blockade the Roads
content: If the government will not listen to our words, they will have to listen to our actions. We will blockade the logging roads.

title: Idle No More
content: We are calling on all allies to stand with the Ebb and Flow First Nation. It's time to be idle no more. #LandDefenders

title: A Violation of International Law
content: The destruction of Indigenous sacred sites is a violation of international human rights law. We are monitoring the situation closely.

title: Stealing From Our Children
content: I want my children to be able to visit our sacred sites and learn our traditions. The government is stealing that from them.

title: Art to Raise Awareness
content: We are using our art to raise awareness about the destruction of the sacred sites. We will not let this be silenced.

title: We Will Defend Our Land
content: Our connection to this land is unbreakable. We will defend it with our last breath. #ProtectOurHeritage

title: 50 Years of Broken Promises
content: 50 years of broken promises. We are still waiting for the health centre that was guaranteed in our treaty. #HealthcareIsATreatyRight

title: A Matter of Life and Death
content: We have lost too many community members to preventable illnesses. The lack of a proper health centre is a matter of life and death.

title: Not a Sustainable System
content: For anything more serious than a cold, we have to be flown out to the city. This is not a sustainable or equitable system of healthcare.

title: Treaty 5 is a Binding Agreement
content: Treaty 5 is not a suggestion. It is a legally binding agreement. The government has a duty to provide healthcare to our people.

title: We are Tired of Waiting
content: We are tired of waiting. We are tired of begging. Build the health centre now. #JusticeForBarrenLands

title: A National Shame
content: The health outcomes for Indigenous peoples in this country are a national shame. We need to close the gap in healthcare services.

title: A Humanitarian Crisis
content: It's shocking that in a country like Canada, there are communities without basic healthcare facilities. This is a humanitarian crisis.

title: The Right to Health
content: The right to health is a fundamental human right. The government's failure to provide a health centre for the Barren Lands First Nation is a violation of that right.

title: Rally at the Legislature
content: We are organizing a rally at the legislature to demand action on the Barren Lands health centre. Please join us.

title: Our Lives Depend on It
content: We will not give up our fight for the right to healthcare. Our lives depend on it. #HealthcareNow

title: They Took My Children
content: I asked for help, and they took my children. They said I was neglectful because I was poor. My heart is broken.

title: Poverty is Not Neglect
content: The child welfare system is punishing parents for being poor. This is a systemic problem that needs to be addressed. #SupportNotSeparation

title: The Government's Priorities are Wrong
content: It costs more to keep a child in foster care than it does to support a family. The government's priorities are all wrong.

title: The Root Cause is Poverty
content: The root cause of this problem is poverty. We need to invest in our communities and create opportunities for everyone.

title: A Multi-Billion Dollar Industry
content: The child welfare system is a multi-billion dollar industry. It has a vested interest in apprehending children.

title: Reform the System From the Inside Out
content: I became a social worker to help families, not to tear them apart. We need to reform the child welfare system from the inside out.

title: Justice for Sagkeeng
content: We are demanding a full investigation into the apprehension of the children from the Sagkeeng First Nation. This injustice cannot stand.

title: You Are Not Alone
content: We provide culturally appropriate support to First Nations families who are involved with the child welfare system. You are not alone.

title: The Child Welfare System is Not the Answer
content: We need to build strong communities that can support families in need. The child welfare system is not the answer.

title: We Will Not Be Broken
content: We will fight to get our children back. We are a strong and resilient people. We will not be broken. #BringOurChildrenHome
